body:
NumberAbs and NumberSign handling in simplified-lowering.cc:

1) NumberAbs: (simplified-lowering.cc)
- Comments: "NumberAbs maps both 0 and -0 to 0, so we can generally pass the kIdentifyZeros truncation to its input, and choose to ignore minus zero in all cases."
- Behavior by input_type:
  * Unsigned32OrMinusZero -> TruncatingWord32 -> Word32 output; lowering: DeferReplacement with ChangeTagged type to Unsigned32.
  * Signed32OrMinusZero -> TruncatingWord32 -> Word32; lowering: DeferReplacement with Int32Abs(node) inserted and type override to Unsigned32.
  * PositiveIntegerOrNaN -> TruncatingFloat64(kIdentifyZeros) -> Float64; lowering: DeferReplacement to input (no-op)
  * default -> TruncatingFloat64(kIdentifyZeros) -> Float64; lowering: ChangeOp to Float64Op(node)
- Relevant lines: simplified-lowering.cc section 2 lines ~3140-3165.

2) NumberSign: (simplified-lowering.cc)
- If InputIs Signed32 -> TruncatingWord32 -> Word32; lowering: DeferReplacement to Int32Sign(node)
- Else -> TruncatingFloat64 -> Float64; lowering: DeferReplacement to Float64Sign(node)
- earlier Float64Sign helper builds selection handling -0 and sign.
- Relevant lines: simplified-lowering.cc section 2 lines ~3500-3520 and Float64Sign helper ~3410-3435.

3) NumberMax/NumberMin lowering via DoMax/DoMin:
- For Word32/Int32/Int64 cases, the code uses VisitWord32TruncatingBinop/VisitInt64Binop and calls lowering->DoMax/DoMin with appropriate machine compare (Uint32LessThan, Int32LessThan, Int64LessThan) and rep (Word32/Word64), performing selection and ignoring minus-zero when truncation identifies zeros.
- For Float64 case: uses UseInfo::TruncatingFloat64(truncation.identify_zeros()) and either lowers to DoMax/DoMin with Float64LessThan/Float64LessThanOrEqual when types are OrderedNumber/PlainNumber depending on truncation. Otherwise falls back to Float64Op(node).
- DoMax/DoMin implementation: Replace inputs with compare node and attach select; ChangeOp(node, common()->Select(rep)). (simplified-lowering.cc lines ~3360-3390 and ~341-344 earlier)

FileLine references: compiler/simplified-lowering.cc: (~3140-3165 NumberAbs), (~3410-3435 Float64Sign), (~3500-3520 NumberSign), (~3360-3390 DoMax/DoMin implementations and usages)
explanation: This entry captures how NumberAbs, NumberSign, Max/Min treat -0 via identify-zero truncations and lowering paths, and where DoMax/DoMin produce selects using comparisons to respect minus-zero semantics when possible.
